text: Solve this problem step by step.
End with 'DONE.' when you have a solution.
Question: A man lives on the 10th floor of an apartment building.
Every morning, he takes the elevator down to the ground floor to go to work.
When he returns in the evening, he takes the elevator to the 7th floor and then walks up the stairs for the remaining floors to his apartment.
However, on rainy days or when there are other people in the elevator, he takes the elevator directly to the 10th floor.

Why does he do this? 

 Solution: 
<think>
Alright, so I have this puzzle here about a man living on the 10th floor.
Let me try to figure out why he does what he does.
Okay, every morning, he takes the elevator down to the ground floor to go to work.
That makes sense because he's starting his day and needs to get to work.
In the evening, when he returns, he takes the elevator to the 7th floor and then walks up the stairs for the remaining floors to his apartment.
Hmm, so from the 7th to the 10th floor, that's 3 floors.

Why not just take the elevator all the way?

But wait, the question also mentions that on rainy days or when there are other people in the elevator, he takes the elevator directly to the 10th floor.
So, normally, he doesn't do that.
So, there must be some reason why he chooses to walk up the stairs instead of taking the elevator all the way home.
Let me think about possible reasons.
Maybe it's about the time it takes.
If he takes the elevator all the way, he might have to wait for it, especially if it's busy.
But the problem says that on rainy days or when there are other people in the elevator, he takes it directly.
So, maybe on normal days, he doesn't mind walking the stairs because it's quicker or he prefers it.
Another angle is the elevator's behavior.
Maybe the elevator doesn't go all the way to the 10th floor every time.
Perhaps it only goes to certain floors, or it stops at certain times.
Wait, but the problem doesn't mention anything about the elevator's route or schedule.
So, maybe it's about something else.
Oh, perhaps it's about the number of floors he has to walk.
From the 7th floor to the 10th, that's 3 floors.
If he takes the elevator to the 7th, maybe that's the highest he can go without waiting too long or dealing with others.
But why wouldn't he just take the elevator all the way? Unless there's something about the elevator's operation that prevents it from going higher when certain conditions are met.
Wait, maybe it's about the elevator's speed or efficiency.
If he takes the elevator to the 7th floor, maybe that's where the elevator changes direction or something.
Or perhaps the elevator only goes up to the 7th floor during certain times, so he has to switch to the stairs after that.
Alternatively, maybe the man has a preference.
He might prefer the exercise of walking the stairs rather than waiting for the elevator.
Or maybe he doesn't mind the walk because it's quicker than waiting for the elevator, especially if it's busy.
But then, on rainy days or when there are other people in the elevator, he takes the elevator all the way.
So, perhaps on those days, he doesn't want to get wet or prefers not to wait for the elevator, hence takes it all the way.
On normal days, maybe he doesn't mind walking the stairs, especially since it's only 3 floors.
Wait, another thought: maybe the elevator doesn't go all the way to the 10th floor at certain times.
So, in the morning, he goes down to the ground floor without any issue.
In the evening, he takes the elevator up to the 7th floor, but if the elevator is busy or it's raining, he takes it all the way.
Otherwise, he walks up the stairs because he doesn't mind the walk.
Alternatively, perhaps the elevator is out of order or not going to the 10th floor, so he takes it to the 7th floor and then walks up.
But the problem doesn't mention that the elevator is broken.
It just says he does this when it's rainy or when there are other people in the elevator.
Wait, maybe it's about the time the elevator takes.
If he takes the elevator all the way, it might take longer because it has to stop at other floors or because it's slower.
So, on rainy days or when there are others, he prefers the quicker option of taking the elevator all the way.
But on normal days, he's okay with walking up the stairs because it's faster for him.
Another possibility is that he doesn't want to deal with other people in the elevator, so on those days, he takes it all the way, avoiding the interaction.

But the problem says he takes the elevator directly to the 10th floor on rainy days or when there are others, so maybe he prefers not to have to wait or deal with others, hence he takes the elevator all the way.
Wait, but why wouldn't he just take the elevator all the way every time? Maybe because when he takes the elevator to the 7th floor, it's a shorter ride and he can control his arrival time better.
Or perhaps the elevator only goes up to the 7th floor during certain times, so he has to walk up the stairs the rest of the way.
I think the key here is that on rainy days or when there are other people in the elevator, he takes the elevator all the way, but on normal days, he prefers to walk up the stairs from the 7th floor.
So, maybe it's about the elevator's availability or his own preference for not waiting or dealing with others.

So, putting it all together, the man takes the elevator to the 7th floor in the evening because it's quicker or he prefers it, but on rainy days or when there are others in the elevator, he takes it all the way because those conditions make it more convenient for him to do so.
So, the reason is about his preference or the elevator's operation when certain conditions are met.

</think>

The man takes the elevator to the 7th floor in the evening because it is more convenient for him, but on rainy days or when the elevator is occupied, he takes it directly to the 10th floor as those conditions make it more practical for him to do so.
